cui_name: Antibody Deficiency due to Defect in CD19
reasoning: Extremely rare genetic primary immunodeficiency caused by CD19 deficiency. Prevalence estimated <0.001 per 100k globally. CD19 deficiency is a specific genetic subtype of CVID with fewer than 50 reported cases worldwide. Using prevalence as this is a lifelong genetic condition with defined mutation.
source: Salzer U et al. (2005). CD19 deficiency resulting in defective B cell proliferation, hypogammaglobulinemia, and recurrent infections. Blood. 104(12):3652-3657
